{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3133368,"name":"rice","username":"riceBoy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/848f3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-25T02:25:02.894Z","cooked":"

Our team is programming a swerve drive. Each module contains a Falcon 500 (driving) and a Neo 775 (rotation). When we try to characterize it using Sysid, the error “Error -3 CTR: CAN frame not received/too-stale.” is displayed on Driver Station and nothing runs. We wrote and deployed our own drive code and it worked, so we believe that this is a Sysid problem.

If we can’t fix this problem soon, is there a way we can write our own characterization code from scratch?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-01-25T02:25:02.894Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":69,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":414.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":424599,"topic_slug":"falcon-500s-and-neo-775s-not-working-with-sysid","display_username":"rice","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52369,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"rice"},"post_url":"/t/falcon-500s-and-neo-775s-not-working-with-sysid/424599/1","custom_user_title":"rice","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3133370,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-25T02:27:21.855Z","cooked":"

Did you mix up the drive and turn motor CAN IDs?

Not that I know of, we’re only using drive motors for characterization right now.

You might’ve accidentally put in the turning motor IDs into SysID. I’d double-check that whenever you can.

I checked Phoenix Tuner and the Sysid config, and confirmed that the port IDs are correct.

Are you enabling in autonomous? Did you select the correct encoder ports? Gyro?

I’d also post a picture of what your driver station and logs look like. Lots of things it could be so it’s better to have more info.

I’m not sure if these will end up fixing the CAN frame issues but…

Generally with drivetrains, the right side motors should be inverted. Check your code and invert in SysID any motors that are inverted in code.

And second, I2C MXP doesn’t seem right… is that what it is in your code? I think normally it’s SPI MXP but maybe I’m dumb and something changed.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-01-25T03:08:53.640Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":39.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":424599,"topic_slug":"falcon-500s-and-neo-775s-not-working-with-sysid","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52369,"username":"riceBoy","name":"rice","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/848f3c/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/falcon-500s-and-neo-775s-not-working-with-sysid/424599/8","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3133399,"name":"rice","username":"riceBoy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/848f3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-25T03:09:35.744Z","cooked":"

We’ll try those changes out and get back to you in a bit. Thanks

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-01-25T03:09:35.744Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":33.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":424599,"topic_slug":"falcon-500s-and-neo-775s-not-working-with-sysid","display_username":"rice","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50684,"username":"crueter","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52369,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"rice"},"post_url":"/t/falcon-500s-and-neo-775s-not-working-with-sysid/424599/9","custom_user_title":"rice","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3133405,"name":"rice","username":"riceBoy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/848f3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-25T03:16:21.035Z","cooked":"

We tried those changes and it said that something was wrong with the configuration of the robot, so our original NavX config is correct.
It seems like the System Identification program is running, but the motors won’t. It said the left and right sides moved 0 units.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2023-01-25T03:16:21.035Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424599,"topic_slug":"falcon-500s-and-neo-775s-not-working-with-sysid","display_username":"rice","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52369,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"rice"},"post_url":"/t/falcon-500s-and-neo-775s-not-working-with-sysid/424599/10","custom_user_title":"rice","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3133407,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-25T03:20:30.984Z","cooked":"

Interesting… At this point I’ve extended beyond my area of expertise so I’d defer to one of the WPILib experts (calcmogul and Oblarg are good guys to ask about SysId). My only suggestion is just to keep checking your code and making sure all the configuration is the same and that you enable in autonomous mode.

riceBoy:

When we try to characterize it using Sysid, the error “Error -3 CTR: CAN frame not received/too-stale.” is displayed on Driver Station and nothing runs. We wrote and deployed our own drive code and it worked, so we believe that this is a Sysid problem.

This is a known issue:

github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid

CAN motor controllers don't move and report timeout/stale CAN messages

opened 06:21PM - 15 Mar 22 UTC
closed 03:27AM - 21 Sep 23 UTC
calcmogul
bug component: generation

We've been getting widespread reports of CAN motor controllers not moving after …either SysId binary (C++ with an RT thread) is deployed. It's gotten so bad that people just aren't using the tool, and most teams use CAN motor controllers. We've confirmed they're using the new roboRIO image, and the console prints messages about CAN message receive timeouts and the messages being stale. The robots under test generally only had like 4 motors installed, so CAN bus overload is unlikely. We've gotten a lot more reports with Falcons than with NEOs, but that could be due to relative marketshare or the proportion of each group of teams that try the tool and mention to us that they had issues. 3512 has gotten stale messages in non-SysId robot code too (C++ with RT thread) with Spark Maxes even after increasing all the non-essential CAN bus status frame periods to 500ms. CAN bus utilization was also low (I wasn't told exactly how much). I don't know if it was ever addressed. At this point, I think the most likely cause is the vendordeps not playing nicely together since the SysId binary links them all in. WPILib has no physical hardware, so we have no way to troubleshoot this. One way someone with hardware could try to narrow down the issue is remove vendordeps from sysid-projects and rebuild/redeploy until the problem goes away.

You could implement custom logging similar to https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid/tree/main/sysid-library/src/main/cpp/logging and https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid/blob/main/sysid-projects/drive/src/main/cpp/DriveRobot.cpp that implement the JSON spec sysid/docs/data-collection.md at main · wpilibsuite/sysid · GitHub.

Some teams on the FRC Discord have done this in Java, but the results have been mixed; Java isn’t a good language for deterministic data sampling due to garbage collection being uncontrollable.

WPILib is looking into using CAN streaming and DMA for 2024 to get more consistent data sampling in Java because it would let teams do system ID in their actual robot code and let us remove the buggy and error-prone project generation code from SysId.

riceBoy:

How effective and complicated do you think writing our own characterization code will be?

You could use this:

SysID broken on 2022.2.1 Technical
We resolved this issue by writing our own SysID logger ( which can be found here. No idea what was causing the original issue…

With Java data collection, Kᵥ tends to be fine, but nondeterministic sampling causes Kₐ to usually be off by a factor of two or more. frc-characterization’s Java data collection had the same issue, which is why SysId (frc-characterization’s replacement) used a C++ robot program with real-time thread priority for data collection instead.

That came with drawbacks though like not being able to sample data in teams’s actual robot code, and random connection issues and CAN timeouts that we’ve never been able to troubleshoot (none of the SysId devs have actual hardware to use for testing).
